Song.title: There Is A Fountain Filled With Blood
Song.copyright: Words & Music by William Cowper Public domain

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [A - A/C# - D2 - A/C# - D/B - E - E7 - A]
VERSE 1: There [A]is a fountain [D2]filled with [A/C#]blood, Drawn [A]from Emm[F#m7]anuel's [E Esus E]veins; And [A]sinners plunged be[D2]neath that [A/C#]flood, Lose [D7/B]all t[D/B]heir [E]guil[E7]ty st[A]ains. Lose [A]all their [A/C#]guilty [D2 D/B]stains, Lose [A]all their [F#m]guilty [E]stains;[E7] And [A]sinners p[A/C#]lunged be[D2]neath that [A/C#]flood, Lose [D7/B]all t[D/B]heir [E]guil[E7]ty st[A - A/C# - D2 - A/C# - D/B - E - E7 - A]ains.
VERSE 2: The [A]dying [A/C#]thief re[D2]joiced to [A/C#]see{,} That [A]fountain [F#m7]in his [E Esus E]day; And [A]there have [A/C#]I, though [D2]vile as [A/C#]he, Washed [D7/B]all [D/B]my [E]sins [E7]aw[A]ay. Washed [A]all my [A/C#]sins a[D2 D/B]way, Washed [A]all my [F#m]sins a[E E7]way; And [A]there have [A/C#]I, though [D2]vile as [A/C#]he, Washed [D7/B]all [D/B]my [E]sins [E7]aw[A - A/C# - D2 - A/C# - D/B - E - E7 - A]ay.
{new_page} VERSE 3: Dear [A]dying [A/C#]Lamb, Thy [D2]precious [A/C#]blood{,} Shall [A]never [F#m7]lose its [E Esus E]power Till [A]all the [A/C#]ransomed [D2]church of [A/C#]God, Be [D7/B]saved, [D/B]to [E]sin [E7]no [A]more. Be [A]saved, to [A/C#]sin no [D2 D/B]more, be [A]saved, to [F#m7]sin no [E E7]more; Till [A]all the [A/C#]ransomed [D2]church of [A/C#]God, Be [D7/B]saved, [D/B]to [E]sin [E7]no [A - A/C# - D2 - A/C# - D/B - E - E7 - A]more.
VERSE 4: E'er [A]since, by [A/C#]faith, I [D2]saw the [A/C#]stream, Thy [A]flowing [F#m7]wounds sup[E Esus E]ply, Re[A]deeming [A/C#]love has [D2]been my [A/C#]theme, And [D7/B]shall [D/B]be [E]till [E7]I [A]die. And [A]shall be [A/C#]till I [D2 D/B]die, And [A]shall be [F#m]till I [E E7]die; Re[A]deeming [A/C#]love has [D2]been my [A/C#]theme, And [D7/B]shall [D/B]be [E]till [E7]I [A - A/C# - D2 - A/C# - D/B - E - E7 - A]die
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 there is a fountain filled with blood drawn from emmanuels veins and sinners plunged beneath that flood lose all their guilty stains lose all their guilty stains lose all their guilty stains and sinners plunged beneath that flood lose all their guilty stains verse 2 the dying thief rejoiced to see that fountain in his day and there have i though vile as he washed all my sins away washed all my sins away washed all my sins away and there have i though vile as he washed all my sins away verse 3 dear dying lamb thy precious blood shall never lose its power till all the ransomed church of god be saved to sin no more be saved to sin no more be saved to sin no more till all the ransomed church of god be saved to sin no more verse 4 eer since by faith i saw the stream thy flowing wounds supply redeeming love has been my theme and shall be till i die and shall be till i die and shall be till i die redeeming love has been my theme and shall be till i die

verse 1 there is a fountain filled with blood drawn from emmanuels veins and sinners plunged beneath that flood lose all their guilty stains lose all their guilty stains lose all their guilty stains and sinners plunged beneath that flood lose all their guilty stains verse 2 the dying thief rejoiced to see that fountain in his day and there have i though vile as he washed all my sins away washed all my sins away washed all my sins away and there have i though vile as he washed all my sins away verse 3 dear dying lamb thy precious blood shall never lose its power till all the ransomed church of god be saved to sin no more be saved to sin no more be saved to sin no more till all the ransomed church of god be saved to sin no more verse 4 eer since by faith i saw the stream thy flowing wounds supply redeeming love has been my theme and shall be till i die and shall be till i die and shall be till i die redeeming love has been my theme and shall be till i die
